page.title: 10REGENTS CANAL, LONDON N.1.
page.content: Regents canal passes under Whitmore Road N.l. A long time ago it was used to carry goods, eg coal and wood. As you walk along the canal you can see the warehouses some of which are in use. But instead of loading onto barges today, goods are loaded onto lorries and containers. Long ago children used to swim and bathe in the canal but the water isn't very clean anymore. Today ducks and fish can be seen swimming in the canal. People can be seen fishing. They look happy and eaceful. There is a Kingsland Basin where narrow boats are kept. Hoxton Trust are planting flowers along the canal side. There is a boat club near Laburnum School, and local teachers use this area with their pupils.
